double entry book-keeping.translation[0]: the accounting system in which each TRANSACTION is recorded twice, as a DEBIT in one account and as a CREDIT in another. For example, a sale is recorded as a credit in one account and the money owed by the buyer is recorded as a debit in another
In double entry bookkeeping the total debits must equal the total credits and by adding the two a check can be made on the double entry.
